column2: Do not bring such petitions before me ever again!

For as long as we have ruled here in [Root.Capital.GetName], we have entrusted the raising of our children to local nursemaids. Our first words would not be [Root.Culture.GetName] but [emf_converted_province.Culture.GetName]. As we grew up, we learned to speak a tongue that was neither one nor the other but a syncretic mix of the two. Perhaps it is time to embrace this new tongue so we all may communicate.

For as long as we have ruled here in [Root.Capital.GetName], we have slowly learned to speak a tongue that was neither our ancestors' nor the locals' but a syncretic mix of the two. Perhaps it is time to embrace this new tongue so we all may communicate.
We shall all embrace the emerging Neapolitan culture.
No, I wish for me and my vassals to remain [Root.Culture.GetName].
It seems that this new [emf_new_culture.GetName] language has now spread into [Root.GetName], a new culture born from a mix of the old.
